meanings.definition: The act of transporting goods by road or rail.
meanings.sent1: The haulages of goods by truck are essential for delivering products to stores.
meanings.sent2: The company calculated the total haulages for the month to determine transportation costs.
meanings.sent3: The haulages of candy for the party made the kids very excited.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like the haulages of a train, unstoppable and efficient.
meanings.sent5: The haulages of furniture up the stairs were exhausting but satisfying.

meanings.sent1: The haulages for shipping overseas can be quite expensive.
meanings.sent2: The business owner carefully monitored the haulages to keep expenses in check.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected increase in haulages caught the company off guard.
meanings.sent4: The haulages of luxury items often come with a hefty price tag.
meanings.sent5: She was shocked by the high haulages for moving her belongings to a new city.

meanings.definition: The distance over which something is transported.
meanings.sent1: The long haulages from the warehouse to the distribution center required efficient planning.
meanings.sent2: The haulages from the farm to the market were longer than expected due to traffic.
meanings.sent3: The haulages of the package seemed never-ending as the delivery truck got stuck in traffic.
meanings.sent4: The haulages of the message from one end of the office to the other were quick thanks to email.
meanings.sent5: The haulages of the goods across the country took several days to complete.
